intro: Astragalus pediculariformis, commonly known as the hooked milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Astragalus pediculariformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
